title: unesco_heritage_Coro_and_its_Port
text:
Name: Coro and its Port. short_description:

With its earthen constructions unique to the Caribbean, Coro is the only surviving example of a rich fusion of local traditions with Spanish Mud√©jar and Dutch architectural techniques. One of the first colonial towns (founded in 1527), it has some 602 historic buildings.
